data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
As you look forward from step 1, you take a total of 9 steps left and 9 steps right. It is impossible to go backward from step 1 if you are facing forward. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take the same number of steps as you would walk back, your starting point would not be the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn around, you need to take 4 steps. To take 6 steps, you need to take 6 steps. To take 4 steps, you need to take 4 steps. For 10 steps, you need to take 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take one step to turn left. Take 7 steps then take 1 step back. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are 3 sets of steps that are a part of the same sequence. Take one set and you are back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around takes 7 steps. Turning opposite direction to the starting point takes 7 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Since right turns to left, the first 8 steps were on the right side of the road. The 2nd 8 steps had to be taken on the left side of the road. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 6 steps to go back up. You take 8 steps to go back up. You take 2 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

One steps forward and one step back. If you take 1 step left, your direction of travel changes one step from right to left. One step forward turns around the turn to the right. If you take 6 steps forward, you make it back the same way as you left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around takes two steps and takes 7 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can only take three steps forward in a row to go backwards. The answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person can return to start point by facing forward and doing the following steps: Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Let “ s” be the initial position number of the previous sequenced steps. If we return to sequence 1, we would return to the direction of change to which we started. One can make one sequenced action in sequential order. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Step right is a different sequence of steps compared to Step 4 steps left. Since you would always face forward and face forward, it would most likely not make sense for you to always be facing left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There is no original starting point in the instructions. If you take 6 steps left, you move 1 step back. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Turn left. There are 24 steps in this sequence. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 10 steps, take 9 steps. Take 3 steps, take 6 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you take 7 steps, then you go to your starting point. If you take 9 steps, then you go to your starting point. If you turn around and are returning, then you are turned right. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn to the left and it has 7 steps to go. Take 2 steps to walk back. Take 7 steps to walk back. If you follow the instructions correctly, it cannot be done. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning right returns where you started. There are 7 steps in the process of turning right. So, the answer is No.

Take 4 steps back; Take 1 step back; Take 3 steps back; Take 6 steps back. The starting point is the place where you started. So, the answer is No.

If you take 5 steps you return to the starting point. If you take 3 steps you return to the starting point. If you take 2 steps you return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you take 3 steps back, you can rewind the process 7 more times to get back to your original starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Since if you are always facing forward, you cannot take 5 steps backward or take steps forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

The instructions state that you have 6 steps to go forward. The final answer: No.

You do not normally turn around at a turning point because it is unsafe to do so. So, the answer is Yes.

6 steps = 6 directions of a correct direction of movement. When you face forward, the direction changes to right and left and left again. As you face forward, you always face left. So, the answer is No.

To return to starting point you have to do as instructed and turn right. If you walk around you have to turn around again. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 2 steps forward and go back behind the person to repeat Step 1. Take 8 steps forward and go back behind the person to repeat Step 1. Again, always face forward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 4 steps, you are taken to step 1 again. If you take 3 steps and return to step 1 you are taken to step 3 again. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point could be any number of steps down the path. It's still on the same path and points the same. So, the answer is yes.

On all sequences you always backward. If you are facing forward you will always take the first sequence to get you to where you started. So, the answer is Yes.

We cannot return to the starting point in six steps in a row. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you take 5 steps backward you are facing right. If you take 4 steps backward you are facing left. When you take 4 steps backward you are facing right. So, the answer is yes.

Each of the first 5 steps you take is forward. The backward step is the same as the left step which is the same as the right step. The last 2 steps you take are left and right. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward, you can’t go back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you take 2 steps, you get 2 steps and in turn take 2 steps. If you take 8 steps, you get 8 steps and in turn take 8 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps forward. Take 4 steps forward. Take 9 steps backward. Take 1 step backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you always take 4 steps forward and take 6 steps forward. You can assume that from the 6 steps forward, you should take 4 steps forward and from the 4 steps forward, you should take 6 steps forward. You’ d take 6 steps forward and get to take 9 steps backward, but if you were 1 step back from the starting point, on the other hand, you would take 1 step back. A person cannot take 1 steps forward back if they wish to take 6 steps forward. There cannot be 10 steps forward back if one does not always keep a right mindset for the remaining distance backward. So, the answer is No.

You add 5 steps to take 5 steps back. If you take 5 steps you add a total of 5 steps to take 5 steps. So, the answer is yes.

Take 6 steps forward and you’re at the starting point. Take 4 steps forward and you’re at the starting point. Take 2 steps forward and you’re at the starting point. Take 3 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

Facing forward always means you are always facing forward. If you take 2 steps backward, you return 2 steps forward. If you take 4 steps backward, you return 4 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

You return to the starting point after Taking 10 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you can always take 7 steps left. Whenever you turn around or sideways, you’ll always take 7 steps. Taking 8 steps right and 8 steps left makes a total of 7 + 8 + 8 = 21 steps. 5 steps left in sequence is 10 steps backward, 10 steps forward. Whenever you turn right or sideways, you'll always take 10 steps. On a reverse rotation, you'll always take 4 steps left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point is the set of steps for facing forward. You may or may not return to your starting point. If you follow the instructions but always face forward you will always be facing forward. So, the answer is No.

If you face forward, you make a circle around the wheel and back to the one you started with. So, the answer is yes.

Take 3 steps to return to the starting point. Take 9 steps to return to the middle of the road. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward with your head up, then when you take 10 steps backward you are taking 10 steps forward. If you take 8 steps backward, then when you take 10 steps forward you are taking 10 steps forward. Taking 10 steps forward is a much faster way of getting there than taking 7 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

You can always face forward, when you go forward with the directions. In one foot forward, 5 feet forward, with the directions. In 2 feet forward, 7 feet backward, with the instructions. So, the answer is Yes.
